turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You have to do it, part of your training as a doctor.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi. My name's Doctor <UNSURE>Gohill</UNSURE>, I'm one of the general practitioners, that works here. Can I check your name and date of birth please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I am, uh, Patrick Smith.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And Patrick, are you in a, space, that's private and quiet?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great, and so, we're OK to chat?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So it says here, um, you are feeling hot, and have had severe headaches. Is that correct?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah. It's, it's really affecting my work. Uh, uh, it comes and goes. Uh.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I kind of, feel like, uh, it's, it's hard 'cause I, I <UNIN/>, kinda lose my appetite.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Also. Uh, one thing that's kinda weird is, I <UNSURE>just</UNSURE> sometimes also get like some, tingling in my arms.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>. And, like, especially if, for example when I, come into the elevator, in the morning.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>I</UNSURE>, I <UNSURE>can uh, of</UNSURE> have, my heart is beating, kinda fast.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, those are lots of things. Are they all happening at the same time?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Almost randomly like. Yeah, it's, it's, it's at different <UNIN/>, times.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, do they all happen at the same time? Or is it one thing one time, and one <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, one time, one thing at a time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, let's <UNSURE>start</UNSURE> with the headaches. When they do come, do you have any idea the headache is going to come?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, not really but, generally during, work times.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm at work, I'm in a meeting, or on my laptop.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, where does the headache sit in your head? <UNSURE>Is it</UNSURE> the front, or the back?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I can't say, so like, kind of <UNSURE>over</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, the headache? No, it's mostly in the front, and then yeah, it just kind of stays there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, when you have the headaches, specifically, do you <UNSURE>feel</UNSURE> sick?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, not, not, not really, but it's like, making it hard. I, yeah, I kind of feel a little bit nauseous maybe. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And sometimes I also feel like.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah. It's like uh, maybe, probably, breathing or something.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, do you normally get headaches, before all of this started?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I, I feel like my, like, health situation was mostly under control.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But it <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, it started roughly when I changed jobs.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, talk to me about your job, what do you do?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, do you work in London at the moment?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, do you get these headaches on your commute in to work?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not really. I get it, mostly when I'm, at work.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and tell me about what you do. Do you sit in front of a computer most of the time? Or do you speak to people?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Like fifty-fifty. I go to meetings and then uh, sit in front of a computer.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, these things have happened mostly when you're sitting at your computer?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and tell me, what did you do, before being a lawyer?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, I was a lawyer <UNSURE>at</UNSURE> previous job as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, talk to me about the stress that you're under at the moment. If, uh, ten out of ten is, extremely stressful, and one out of ten is being on vacation. Where <UNSURE>would</UNSURE> <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> moment?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, is that normal for you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it's like, a law firm, like, there's always pressure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, you mentioned your headaches. You also mentioned your reduced appetite. So, you don't want to eat as much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Can you remember how much you've lost?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, is that because you're going to the gym? Or is that unintentional?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, have you noticed your clothes feeling looser?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, have people said, or commented that you've lost weight?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Great</UNSURE>. And, another thing that you also mentioned. Is that you noticed tingling in your hand.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, talk to me about that. Is it in one hand? Or both hands?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, do you get that in your legs as well?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, what does it feel like, the tingling?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And again, is this the first time you've noticed this?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And the other two things that I've just, jotted down. Is, you're feeling hot, but you didn't mention that.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I would say like, I get this like, feeling of, <UNSURE>short</UNSURE>, like, <UNIN/>, short of breath, sometimes.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So, like, that could be what, you we're, referring to.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yes. So, do you feel short of breath while you're sitting at your desk?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>. OK. And, how about when you're exercising?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And the last thing is. You mentioned that you noticed your heart beating?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Again, how often do you get that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I, I, when I like, it's maybe once a day, uh, maybe more. Uh.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: There's one more thing that I, I think I should mention, like, I do have like, some loss of libido at home.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. How long has that been happening for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Same amount of time really, like, since I changed my job.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fine. And, apart from all of these things that you've told me. Do you have any other medical problems?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, do you take medications for that?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, are you remembering to take your medications?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, do you drink or smoke?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Like, once a week, couple of glasses, of wine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, uh, I need to ask this to all of my patients, but do you do anything else recreational, in terms of drugs?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, you've never taken cocaine, or marijuana?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, thank you. And, are you allergic to anything?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good. So, you've told me lots of things happening to you at the moment, and I can understand, they probably feel quite strange and unusual.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, I think the best course of action is, you come and see, one of our doctors, in the clinic.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>We</UNSURE> can give you an examination, and what that means is, we check your heart and your breathing.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Make sure that those things are functioning correctly.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And probably do some blood tests, for your <UNSURE>thyroxine</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And take it from there. How does that sound?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: That sounds, uh, very good. Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I think before we give you any medications, we should see you in person.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, <UNSURE>what we're</UNSURE> going to do is book an appointment. Or I think you can book an appointment through the app, to come and <UNSURE>see us</UNSURE> <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> clinic, and see one of my colleagues.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'll let them know what you've told me today, so you won't have to repeat exactly what you've said.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great. Do you have any questions?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, that was it. Thank you very much.
